data.event: A 166 kilometers long road connecting Sodo with Chida, whose construction had started in 1994, was completed by early 1999.
A 166 kilometers long road connecting Sodo with Chida, whose construction had started in 1994, was completed by early 1999.

According to the SNNPR's Bureau of Finance and Economic Development, as of 2003 Sodo's amenities include digital and mobile telephone access, postal service, 24-hour electrical service, two banks, and a hospital.
In the early 1930s, Sodo was described as the only locality in Wolaita district deserving to be called a town.

Italian ground troops captured Sodo on 27 January 1937; it was there that two Italian generals with their divisions – Liberati with his 25th Division, and Bacarri with his 101st Division – surrendered on 22 May 1941, after a minimum of resistance.
